# Security Policy

We take the security of Browza users and data seriously. If you believe you’ve found a vulnerability, **please notify us privately** so we can investigate and fix it quickly.

## How to report

- Email: **aditya.jadhav@browza.in**  
- Subject: `Vulnerability Report: <short title>`  
- Include: affected endpoints/pages, reproduction steps, impact, screenshots/PoC, and your contact info.

> Please **do not** open public GitHub issues for security reports.

## Our commitment

- We’ll acknowledge your report within **72 hours**.
- We’ll provide a remediation update within **7 days** (or sooner).
- After a fix, we’ll share a brief summary of the root cause and mitigation.

## Scope (for this repository)

- **In scope:** Frontend code in this repo (Next.js app), client-side logic, API route handlers living under `app/api/*` that are part of this project.
- **Out of scope:** Third-party services, demo/mock endpoints (`/api/mock/*`), social engineering, DoS/volume testing, findings that require device compromise, or browser extensions.

## Coordinated disclosure

Please give us reasonable time to remediate before any public disclosure. If you run into any uncertainty about in-scope testing, email us first.

## PGP (optional)

If you require encrypted communications, email us to request a PGP key.
